606aab74-8580-48e9-a9da-82f40e511208.question:
Tweet: vibe-coding is actually so fun when you don't use CLI only

i like how Antigravity works
606aab74-8580-48e9-a9da-82f40e511208.answer: cli is a necessary evil, i guess, but anything that gets you doing instead of configuring is a win. antigravity’s drag-and-drop workflow is a beautiful escape from tons of terminal commands

ab6e3b86-2d57-499b-9ee9-d08159e0ee46.question: Tweet: The thing Andrew says here about how cliched parenting is, how everything you think and feel about it is represented in some well-worn cliche or another, is one of the best things about having kids. It’s the death of cool, in some sense. The demise of the demand for personal
ab6e3b86-2d57-499b-9ee9-d08159e0ee46.answer: right? it's freeing to just ditch the carefully curated persona and embrace the utter absurdity of it all, like, i used to think i was so unique, now i'm just another parent yelling about sleep.

2953df11-1c28-47ef-8907-c702ae294854.question: Tweet: The thing Andrew says here about how cliched parenting is, how everything you think and feel about it is represented in some well-worn cliche or another, is one of the best things about having kids. It’s the death of cool, in some sense. The demise of the demand for personal
2953df11-1c28-47ef-8907-c702ae294854.answer: it's wild, right? like, I wanted to be a totally different parent and now I see every cliché coming—it's kinda nice realizing you're not alone.

048c5a16-37f8-4991-a5b3-25d4d39bfce4.question: Tweet: The thing Andrew says here about how cliched parenting is, how everything you think and feel about it is represented in some well-worn cliche or another, is one of the best things about having kids. It’s the death of cool, in some sense. The demise of the demand for personal
048c5a16-37f8-4991-a5b3-25d4d39bfce4.answer: it's freeing, right? like, you’re already bracing for the eye-roll when you inevitably say something someone’s heard a million times, so you just own it. it's a shortcut to genuine connection, weirdly.

b1ae254b-de20-4fe8-b6d1-97a6ad5f7d92.question: Tweet: The thing Andrew says here about how cliched parenting is, how everything you think and feel about it is represented in some well-worn cliche or another, is one of the best things about having kids. It’s the death of cool, in some sense. The demise of the demand for personal
b1ae254b-de20-4fe8-b6d1-97a6ad5f7d92.answer: It's wild how quickly you realize you're just saying the same stuff your parents did—but now it's you! It's kinda cool to just admit it, though.

ec13a36a-8412-4809-b96b-ff391abd3ba6.question: Tweet: The thing Andrew says here about how cliched parenting is, how everything you think and feel about it is represented in some well-worn cliche or another, is one of the best things about having kids. It’s the death of cool, in some sense. The demise of the demand for personal
ec13a36a-8412-4809-b96b-ff391abd3ba6.answer: it's also the birth of a strange kind of freedom, once you’re officially uncool, you can just be, you know? like, i used to curate an image, now i just chase my kid around covered in peanut butter.

b7958f75-f4ae-43e5-83d0-83d3fa6c6f95.question:
Tweet: Even though it's Christmas you still have to keep pushing, I've enjoyed time with the family, completed my 10k steps and found a little time to continue pushing on my app idea

I'm still trying to find that happy place where I can switch from build to ship
b7958f75-f4ae-43e5-83d0-83d3fa6c6f95.answer: "Moving from planning to actually launching is rough—feels like constant work, just starting over with tweaks. Sometimes you gotta release things even if they're not quite right and accept they'll never be exactly what you imagined."

b9747cdf-5e35-4bfc-a234-f7a2aaec7403.question:
Tweet: Even though it's Christmas you still have to keep pushing, I've enjoyed time with the family, completed my 10k steps and found a little time to continue pushing on my app idea

I'm still trying to find that happy place where I can switch from build to ship
b9747cdf-5e35-4bfc-a234-f7a2aaec7403.answer: Ugh, that ship or build choice is rough—it's never easy, just a constant stress until it's live. Just put something out there, anything, and fix it later—waiting for perfect means nothing ever ships.

8fe85bd8-813d-485c-a595-d08299c1b57e.question:
Tweet: Even though it's Christmas you still have to keep pushing, I've enjoyed time with the family, completed my 10k steps and found a little time to continue pushing on my app idea

I'm still trying to find that happy place where I can switch from build to ship
8fe85bd8-813d-485c-a595-d08299c1b57e.answer: that ship/build is rough,it’s like you’re always tweaking, but it’s easy to get stuck, so set a deadline and just put something out. you'll improve quicker with users than you will staring at code.

105b41b3-d855-4c68-9d50-295f6fdfd452.question: Tweet: the only thing that makes all of this work worth it at the end is seeing people around you smiling
105b41b3-d855-4c68-9d50-295f6fdfd452.answer: That's true, but you shouldn't need someone else's approval to feel good about what you do,just find something that makes you happy, no matter what.

a99f9e54-56f3-4ab0-bfed-945e87c1c3eb.question:
Tweet: First sale on Day 2 ($24) 
No sales since then.

Instead of getting discouraged, I focused on feedback and improvements.

Building takes patience.
You don’t quit when it gets quiet.
You keep going
a99f9e54-56f3-4ab0-bfed-945e87c1c3eb.answer: two bucks on day two? that's a launch, not a failure. focus on that initial spark and fan the flames, the quiet is just a chance to sharpen the pitch

fcdb833e-50fa-4899-8802-aa17ede49cec.question:
Tweet: First sale on Day 2 ($24) 
No sales since then.

Instead of getting discouraged, I focused on feedback and improvements.

Building takes patience.
You don’t quit when it gets quiet.
You keep going
fcdb833e-50fa-4899-8802-aa17ede49cec.answer: two bucks on day two? that’s a start, don’t measure progress by immediate sales, measure it by how much you’ve learned and what you’ve tweaked. most things worth doing take longer than we want them to.
